blog.name: cutlike-a-buffalo
blog.title: Never for money, always for love.

body:
It’s obvious for everyone that Jaime and Brienne have feelings for each other.

Many of their interactions are parallels to Jon and Sansa.

Jon and Sansa show more love in their expressions.

Look at the difference, while Jaime and Brienne try to mask it. Jon and Sansa can’t, it shows.

And yet some people still deny there’s something there.

summary: I don't even know why I have to keep addressing this...
body:
I don’t even know why I have to keep addressing this…

But due to some people beliefs

I

Do

Not

Hate

Sansa stark.

In fact, I have massive respect for her as a character and especially her story arc. Do I make fun of said ship I don’t like? Or fun of the opposing party yes, of course I do. But I do that with everyone and that don’t mean I dislike her 💀.

So calling me a sansa hater? I ain’t one of them sis 👏🏾

summary: You know what one of my favorite things ever is? Knowing that if ever presented with the choice, each and every single one of...
body: You know what one of my favorite things ever is? Knowing that if ever presented with the choice, each and every single one of the Starks (including Jon) would unequivocally and without doubt choose Sansa over Dany and seeing antis foaming at the mouth, vehemently trying to deny that fact

summary: The Moon Tower Secret - SoHereWeAre - Game of Thrones (TV) [Archive of Our Own]
title: The Moon Tower Secret - SoHereWeAre - Game of Thrones (TV) [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Chapters: 3/?
Fandom: Game of Thrones (TV), A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin, A Song of Ice and Fire & Related Fandoms
Rating: Explicit
Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
Relationships: Harrold Hardyng/Sansa Stark, Harrold Hardyng/Alayne Stone, Robb Stark/Sansa Stark
Characters: Sansa Stark, Robb Stark, Harrold Hardyng, Petyr Baelish
Additional Tags: Wedding Night, Sibling Incest, Brother/Sister Incest, Incest, Loss of Virginity, Cuckolding, Excessive Drinking, Non-Consensual Drug Use, Missionary Position, Cunnilingus, Oral Sex, Seduction, Explicit Language, Explicit Sexual Content, Vaginal Sex, Deception, Resentment, Forbidden Love, Alternate Universe - Canon Divergence, Robb Lives, Plot What Plot/Porn Without Plot, Voyeurism, Jealousy, Passion, Dirty Talk, Out of Character, Robbsa, I Wrote This Instead of Sleeping, Red Wedding Does Not Happen, just go with it
Summary:

Alayne Stone is revealed to be Sansa Stark as she marries Harold Hardyng after SweetRobin’s death. The purpose is to seduce Harry into securing his support, the Vale, and its Army along with what is left of Robb’s loyal men in a plan to retake Winterfell.
However, Sansa has other intentions on her wedding night as she invites Robb into her bed to take her maidenhead, deeming “Harry the Arse” too unworthy. She just doesn’t plan for what happens afterwards when unexpected feelings and pleasures grow between her and her new husband.

Heed the tags. Both pairings are tagged because both pairings happen.
Canon Divergence - There was no Red Wedding and Robb lives. Because he can. ;)

Yes, I am turning this into a main Harry x Sansa fic. I can’t help it. I love it and won’t deny it. :)

Additional Tags: One Night Stands, Explicit Sexual Content, Sexual Content, Aliases, Roleplay, Explicit Language, Vaginal Fingering, Fingerfucking, Vaginal Sex, Cunnilingus, Orgasm, Wall Sex, Power Dynamics, Making Out, Public Display of Affection, Casual Sex, French Kissing, Passion, Oral Sex, Foreplay, Attraction, Alternate Universe - Modern Setting, Personality Swap, Hair Dyeing, One Shot, I Ship It, NSFW Gif At The End
Summary:

Sansa grows bold after dyeing her hair and decides to give rumored Office Lothario Harry Hardyng a go.
She can do it. After all, she’s Alayne in a bar, not good and perfect Sansa Stark…

Just a one-shot. I couldn’t resist. I keep seeing Bradley James as Harry Hardyng and that man is one very sexy inspiration. And sansafeels shares the blame.

Title is from “Comin’ Under Fire” by Def Leppard. Kind of suits Harry in this so forgive the 80’s cheese. :)

summary:
The reason why I believe a showdown between Sansa and Cersei is imminent in season 8:
There are four clear antagonists in...
body:
The reason why I believe a showdown between Sansa and Cersei is imminent in season 8:

There are four clear antagonists in Sansa’s storyline - Joffrey, Cersei, Ramsey and Littlefinger, and so far she has been involved in bringing about each of their downfalls whether directly or indirectly.

Joffrey Baratheon:

Sansa telling Olenna about Joffrey being a monster is what set the plan of his murder into motion.

She was also wearing the necklace that carried the poison used to kill him.

Ramsey Bolton:

Sansa is the one who convinced Jon to fight against Ramsey and take back Winterfell.

She also used his own hounds to kill him.

Petyr Baelish ( Littlefinger ):

Sansa along with Arya and Bran tricked Littlefinger into attending the trial and executed him.

Cersei Lannister:

Cersei was one of the earliest tormentors in Sansa’s life. She manipulated and emotionally abused her repeatedly and destroyed whatever romantic notions Sansa held about being Queen.

Her connection with Cersei is also emphasised in Season 7 and the audience is reminded of the impact Cersei had on Sansa. Sansa definitely learned how to be a successful political player from Cersei but she also learned how to not become her.

Sansa even says “if they want another Stark prisoner, they can come and take me” which when paired with Arya saying she needs better guards seems to be foreshadowing the kidnapping plot.

Cersei also has not forgotten about Sansa and her involvement in the death of Joffrey and subsequently her other children. Throughout Season 6 and 7 Cersei arc has been about revenge on everyone who has wronged her like The High Sparrow, Septa Unella, Olenna Tyrell, Ellaria Sand among others. Sansa is someone she definitely counts among these people.

Them confronting each other will also be a moment of satisfaction as it will depict how much the power dynamic has changed between them as Sansa is no longer the ‘little dove’ Cersei can dominate over.

I also believe Sansa is definitely the YMBQ as she indirectly led to the death of all of Cersei’s children who were what Cersei held dearest to her.

Narratively, it makes sense for Sansa to play a part in bringing about Cersei’s downfall.

reblog.comment:
The reason why I believe a showdown between Sansa and Cersei is imminent in season 8:

There are four clear antagonists in Sansa’s storyline - Joffrey, Cersei, Ramsey and Littlefinger, and so far she has been involved in bringing about each of their downfalls whether directly or indirectly.

Joffrey Baratheon:

Sansa telling Olenna about Joffrey being a monster is what set the plan of his murder into motion.

She was also wearing the necklace that carried the poison used to kill him.

Ramsey Bolton:

Sansa is the one who convinced Jon to fight against Ramsey and take back Winterfell.

She also used his own hounds to kill him.

Petyr Baelish ( Littlefinger ):

Sansa along with Arya and Bran tricked Littlefinger into attending the trial and executed him.

Cersei Lannister:

Cersei was one of the earliest tormentors in Sansa’s life. She manipulated and emotionally abused her repeatedly and destroyed whatever romantic notions Sansa held about being Queen.

Her connection with Cersei is also emphasised in Season 7 and the audience is reminded of the impact Cersei had on Sansa. Sansa definitely learned how to be a successful political player from Cersei but she also learned how to not become her.

Sansa even says “if they want another Stark prisoner, they can come and take me” which when paired with Arya saying she needs better guards seems to be foreshadowing the kidnapping plot.

Cersei also has not forgotten about Sansa and her involvement in the death of Joffrey and subsequently her other children. Throughout Season 6 and 7 Cersei arc has been about revenge on everyone who has wronged her like The High Sparrow, Septa Unella, Olenna Tyrell, Ellaria Sand among others. Sansa is someone she definitely counts among these people.

Them confronting each other will also be a moment of satisfaction as it will depict how much the power dynamic has changed between them as Sansa is no longer the ‘little dove’ Cersei can dominate over.

I also believe Sansa is definitely the YMBQ as she indirectly led to the death of all of Cersei’s children who were what Cersei held dearest to her.

Narratively, it makes sense for Sansa to play a part in bringing about Cersei’s downfall.

title: Je ne te perdrai plus jamais.
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2T2XOrX

by AngelicaR2

[Time-Travel!AU. Fix-it. Post-S7] : Lors du combat contre les Marcheurs Blancs, alors que tout semble perdu, Mélisandre réussit à renvoyer cinq personnes dans le passé, qui auront pour mission de changer les choses. Et de sauver le monde par la même occasion. Angst, fluff, fin heureuse, romance. N’est pas fidèle au canon. Slash, femslash, ships canons ou non. Slow Burn.

Words: 1298, Chapters: 1/?, Language: Français

  • Fandoms: Game of Thrones (TV)
  • Rating: Mature
  • Warnings: Graphic Depictions Of Violence, Major Character Death
  • Categories: F/F, F/M, Gen, M/M
